references.paper_title: Mind2Web: Towards a generalist agent for the web
references.reason: This paper introduces a benchmark dataset, Mind2Web, used to evaluate the performance of the proposed model, providing a crucial context for understanding its capabilities and limitations.

references.paper_title: VisualWebArena: Evaluating multimodal agents on realistic visual web tasks
references.reason: This paper introduces VisualWebArena, another benchmark dataset used for evaluation, enhancing the credibility and scope of the research by offering another perspective.

references.paper_title: WebShop: Towards scalable real-world web interaction with grounded language agents
references.reason: This paper's benchmark, WebShop, is a precursor to the benchmarks used and helps situate the current work within the evolution of web agent research.

references.paper_title: Tree of thoughts: Deliberate problem solving with large language models
references.reason: This work explores the use of large language models for planning, which is the core methodology of the proposed approach in the current paper; the theoretical groundwork is thus fundamental.
This paper lays the foundation for model-based planning, which is central to the proposed method; it is among the earliest and most influential papers on this topic.
